info.title: validateapi
info.description: The validation APIs help you validate data. Check if an E-mail address is real. Check if a domain is real. Check up on an IP address, and even where it is located. All this and much more is available in the validation API.

post.summary: Parse an unstructured input text string into an international, formatted address
post.description: Uses machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to handle a wide array of cases, including non-standard and unstructured address strings across a wide array of countries and address formatting norms.

post.summary: Validate a street address
post.description: Determines if an input structured street address is valid or invalid.  If the address is valid, also returns the latitude and longitude of the address.  Supports all major international addresses.

post.summary: Normalize a street address
post.description: Normalizes an input structured street address is valid or invalid.  If the address is valid, also returns the latitude and longitude of the address.  Supports all major international addresses.

post.summary: Validate a City and State/Province combination, get location information about it
post.description: Checks if the input city and state name or code is valid, and returns information about it such as normalized City name, State name and more.  Supports all major international addresses.

post.summary: Validate a state or province, name or abbreviation, get location information about it
post.description: Checks if the input state name or code is valid, and returns information about it such as normalized State name and more.  Supports all major countries.

post.summary: Validate a postal code, get location information about it
post.description: Checks if the input postal code is valid, and returns information about it such as City, State and more.  Supports all major countries.

post.summary: Validate and normalize country information, return ISO 3166-1 country codes and country name
post.description: Validates and normalizes country information, and returns key information about a country, as well as whether it is a member of the European Union.  Also returns distinct time zones in the country.

post.summary: Get a list of ISO 3166-1 countries
post.description: Enumerates the list of ISO 3166-1 countries, including name, country codes, and more.

post.summary: Check if a country is a member of the European Union (EU)
post.description: Checks if the input country is a member of the European Union or not.

post.summary: Get the currency of the input country
post.description: Gets the currency information for the input country, including the ISO three-letter country code, currency symbol, and English currency name.

post.summary: Get the region, subregion and continent of the country
post.description: Gets the continent information including region and subregion for the input country.

post.summary: Gets IANA/Olsen time zones for a country
post.description: Gets the IANA/Olsen time zones for a country.

post.summary: Geocode a street address into latitude and longitude
post.description: Geocodes a street address into latitude and longitude.

post.summary: Reverse geocode a lattitude and longitude into an address
post.description: Converts lattitude and longitude coordinates into an address through reverse-geocoding.

get.summary: Get current date and time as of now
get.description: Gets the current date and time.  Response time is syncronized with atomic clocks, and represents a monotonic, centrally available, consistent clock.

post.summary: Get public holidays in the specified country and year
post.description: Enumerates all public holidays in a given country for a given year.  Supports over 100 countries.

post.summary: Parses a standardized date and time string into a date and time
post.description: Parses a structured date and time string into a date time object.  This is intended for standardized date strings that adhere to formatting conventions, rather than natural language input.

post.summary: Parses a free-form natural language date and time string into a date and time
post.description: Parses an unstructured, free-form, natural language date and time string into a date time object.  This is intended for lightweight human-entered input, such as "tomorrow at 3pm" or "tuesday".

post.summary: Validate a domain name
post.description: Check whether a domain name is valid or not.  API performs a live validation by contacting DNS services to validate the existence of the domain name.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Domain name to check, for example "cloudmersive.com".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Validate a domain name's quality score
post.description: Check the quality of a domain name.  Supports over 9 million domain names.  Higher quality scores indicate more trust and authority in the domain name, with values ranging from 0.0 (low quality) to 10.0 (maximum quality).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Domain name to check, for example "cloudmersive.com".

post.summary: Get WHOIS information for a domain
post.description: Validate whether a domain name exists, and also return the full WHOIS record for that domain name.  WHOIS records include all the registration details of the domain name, such as information about the domain's owners.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Domain name to check, for example "cloudmersive.com".   The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Validate a URL syntactically
post.description: Validate whether a URL is syntactically valid (does not check endpoint for validity).  Accepts various types of input and produces a well-formed URL as output.

post.summary: Validate a URL fully
post.description: Validate whether a URL is syntactically valid (does not check endpoint for validity), whether it exists, and whether the endpoint is up and passes virus scan checks.  Accepts various types of input and produces a well-formed URL as output.

post.summary: Get top-level domain name from URL
post.description: Gets the top-level domain name from a URL, such as mydomain.com.

post.summary: Check a URL for Phishing threats
post.description: Checks if an input URL is at risk of being an Phishing (fake login page, or other page designed to collect information via social engineering) threat or attack.

post.summary: Check if path is a high-risk or vulnerable server administration path
post.description: Check if the input URL or relative path is a server Administration Path, and therefore a risk or vulnerability for remote access.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: URL or relative path to check, e.g. "/admin/login".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Check a URL for safety threats
post.description: Checks if an input URL is at risk of being a safety threat through malware, unwanted software, or social engineering threats.

post.summary: Check a URL for SSRF threats
post.description: Checks if an input URL is at risk of being an SSRF (Server-side request forgery) threat or attack.

post.summary: Check a URL for SSRF threats in batches
post.description: Batch-checks if input URLs are at risk of being an SSRF (Server-side request forgery) threat or attack.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Input URL request as a batch of multiple URLs

post.summary: Check a URL for HTML embedded SSRF threats
post.description: Checks if an input URL HTML is at risk of containing one or more embedded SSRF (Server-side request forgery) threats or attacks.

post.summary: Validate email adddress for syntactic correctness only
post.description: Validate whether a given email address is syntactically correct via a limited local-only check.  Use the address/full API to do a full validation.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Email address to validate, e.g. "support@cloudmersive.com".    The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Partially check whether an email address is valid
post.description: Validate an email address by identifying whether its parent domain has email servers defined.  This call is less limited than syntaxOnly but not as comprehensive as address/full.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to validate, e.g. "support@cloudmersive.com".    The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Fully validate an email address
post.description: Performs a full validation of the email address.  Checks for syntactic correctness, identifies the mail server in question if any, and then contacts the email server to validate the existence of the account - without sending any emails.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address to validate, e.g. "support@cloudmersive.com".    The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Get intelligence on an IP address
post.description: Identify key intelligence about an IP address, including if it is a known threat IP, known bot, Tor exit node, as well as the location of the IP address.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to process, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Geolocate an IP address
post.description: Identify an IP address Country, State/Provence, City, Zip/Postal Code, etc.  Useful for security and UX applications.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to geolocate, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Geolocate an IP address to a street address
post.description: Identify an IP address's street address.  Useful for security and UX applications.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to geolocate, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Check if IP address is a known threat
post.description: Check if the input IP address is a known threat IP address.  Checks against known bad IPs, botnets, compromised servers, and other lists of threats.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to check, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Check if IP address is a Tor node server
post.description: Check if the input IP address is a Tor exit node server.  Tor servers are a type of privacy-preserving technology that can hide the original IP address who makes a request.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to check, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Check if IP address is a Bot client
post.description: Check if the input IP address is a Bot, robot, or otherwise a non-user entity.  Leverages real-time signals to check against known high-probability bots..

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to check, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Perform a reverse domain name (DNS) lookup on an IP address
post.description: Gets the domain name, if any, associated with the IP address.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: IP address to check, e.g. "55.55.55.55".  The input is a string so be sure to enclose it in double-quotes.

post.summary: Enrich an input lead with additional fields of data

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Input lead with known fields set, and unknown fields left blank (null)

post.summary: Get company information from email address
Parse and validate a full name
post.description: Parses a full name string (e.g. "Mr. Jon van der Waal Jr.") into its component parts (and returns these component parts), and then validates whether it is a valid name string or not

post.summary: Validate a first name
post.description: Determines if a string is a valid first name (given name)

post.summary: Validate a last name
post.description: Determines if a string is a valid last name (surname)

post.summary: Get the gender of a first name
post.description: Determines the gender of a first name (given name)

post.summary: Validate a code identifier
post.description: Determines if the input name is a valid technical / code identifier.  Configure input rules such as whether whitespace, hyphens, underscores, etc. are allowed.  For example, a valid identifier might be "helloWorld" but not "hello*World".

post.summary: Validate phone number (basic)
post.description: Validate a phone number by analyzing the syntax

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Phone number to validate in a PhoneNumberValidateRequest object.  Try a phone number such as "1.800.463.3339", and either leave DefaultCountryCode blank or use "US".

post.summary: Check text input for SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks
post.description: Detects SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks from text input.

parameters.name: detectionLevel
parameters.description: Set to Normal to target a high-security SQL Injection detection level with a very low false positive rate; select High to target a very-high security SQL Injection detection level with higher false positives.  Default is Normal (recommended).

post.summary: Check and protect multiple text inputs for SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks in batch
post.description: Detects SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks from multiple text inputs.  Output preverses order of input items.

post.summary: Check text input for Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) attacks
post.description: Detects XSS (Cross-Site-Scripting) attacks from text input.

post.summary: Protect text input from Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) attacks through normalization
post.description: Detects and removes XSS (Cross-Site-Scripting) attacks from text input through normalization.  Returns the normalized result, as well as information on whether the original input contained an XSS risk.

post.summary: Check and protect multiple text inputs for Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) attacks in batch
post.description: Detects XSS (Cross-Site-Scripting) attacks from multiple text inputs.  Output preverses order of input items.

post.summary: Protect html input from Server-side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks
post.description: Detects SSRF (Server-side request forgery) attacks and unsafe URL attacks from HTML text input, where attackers can attempt to access unsafe local or network paths in the server environment by injecting them into HTML.

parameters.name: allowCidScheme
parameters.description: Optional: Set to true to allow cid: scheme URLs for email message attachments.  Default is false.

post.summary: Protect text input from XML External Entity (XXE) attacks
post.description: Detects XXE (XML External Entity) attacks from text input.

parameters.name: allowInternetUrls
parameters.description: Optional: Set to true to allow Internet-based dependency URLs for DTDs and other XML External Entitites, set to false to block.  Default is false.

parameters.name: knownSafeUrls
parameters.description: Optional: Comma separated list of fully-qualified URLs that will automatically be considered safe.

parameters.name: knownUnsafeUrls
parameters.description: Optional: Comma separated list of fully-qualified URLs that will automatically be considered unsafe.

post.summary: Protect text input from XML External Entity (XXE) attacks
post.description: Detects XXE (XML External Entity) attacks from text input.

post.summary: Parse an HTTP User-Agent string, identify robots
post.description: Uses a parsing system and database to parse the User-Agent into its structured component parts, such as Browser, Browser Version, Browser Engine, Operating System, and importantly, Robot identification.

post.summary: Validate a VAT number
post.description: Checks if a VAT code is valid, and if it is, returns more information about it.  The first two letters of the VAT number must be letters that indicate the country, such as LU20260743.  Possible country codes include Austria (AT), Belgium (BE), Bulgaria (BG), Cyprus (CY), Czech Republic (CZ), Germany (DE), Denmark (DK), Estonia (EE), Greece (EL), Spain (ES), Finland (FI), France (FR), United Kingdom (GB), Croatia (HR), Hungary (HU), Ireland (IE), Italy (IT), Lithuania (LT), Luxembourg (LU), Latvia (LV), Malta (MT), The Netherlands (NL), Poland (PL), Portugal (PT), Romania (RO), Sweden (SE), Slovenia (SI), Slovakia (SK).

ParseAddressRequest.description: Request to parse an address formatted as a string/free text into a structured address

AddressString.description: A mailing address or street address formatted as a single text string; this will be parsed into its components

CapitalizationMode.description: Optional; indicates how the parsed output should be capitalized; default is Title Case; possible values are: "Uppercase" will set the capitalization to UPPER CASE; "Lowercase" will set the capitalization to lower case; "Titlecase" will set the capitalization to Title Case; and "Originalcase" will preserve the original casing as much as possible

ParseAddressResponse.description: Result of parsing an address into its component parts

Successful.description: True if the parsing operation was successful, false otherwise

Building.description: The name of the building, house or structure if applicable, such as "Cloudmersive Building 2".  This will often by null.

StreetNumber.description: The street number or house number of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "1600".  This value will typically be populated for most addresses.

Street.description: The name of the street or road of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "Pennsylvania Avenue NW".

StateOrProvince.description: The state or province of the address.

PostalCode.description: The postal code or zip code of the address.

CountryFullName.description: Country of the address, if present in the address.  If not included in the address it will be null.

ValidateAddressRequest.description: Request to Validate a Street Address

StreetAddress.description: Required; Street address to validate, such as '2950 Buskirk Ave.'

City.description: Required; City part of the addrerss to validate, such as 'Walnut Creek'

StateOrProvince.description: Required; State or province of the address to validate, such as 'CA' or 'California'

PostalCode.description: Optional (recommended); Zip code or postal code of the address to validate, such as '94597'

CountryFullName.description: Optional (recommended); Name of the country, such as 'United States'.  If left blank, and CountryCode is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

CountryCode.description: Optional; two-letter country code (Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code) of the country.  If left blank, and CountryFullName is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

ValidateAddressResponse.description: Result of validating a street address

ValidAddress.description: True if the address is valid, false otherwise

Latitude.description: If the address is valid, the degrees latitude of the validated address, null otherwise

Longitude.description: If the address is valid, the degrees longitude of the validated address, null otherwise

NormalizeAddressResponse.description: Result of validating a street address

ValidAddress.description: True if the address is valid, false otherwise

Building.description: The name of the building, house or structure if applicable, such as "Cloudmersive Building 2".  This will often by null.

StreetNumber.description: The street number or house number of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "1600".  This value will typically be populated for most addresses.

Street.description: The name of the street or road of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "Pennsylvania Avenue NW".

StateOrProvince.description: The state or province of the address.

PostalCode.description: The postal code or zip code of the address.

CountryFullName.description: Country of the address, if present in the address.  If not included in the address it will be null.

Latitude.description: If the address is valid, the degrees latitude of the validated address, null otherwise

Longitude.description: If the address is valid, the degrees longitude of the validated address, null otherwise

ValidateCityRequest.description: Request to Validate a City and State or Province in a country

City.description: Required: City of the address to validate, such as 'San Francisco' or 'London'

StateOrProvince.description: Required: State or province of the address to validate, such as 'California' or 'CA'

CountryFullName.description: Optional (recommended); Name of the country, such as 'United States'.  If left blank, and CountryCode is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

CountryCode.description: Optional; two-letter country code (Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code) of the country.  If left blank, and CountryFullName is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

ValidCity.description: True if the city is valid, false otherwise

City.description: If valid, City corresponding to the input postal code, such as 'Walnut Creek'

StateOrProvince.description: If valid; State or province corresponding to the input state name, such as 'CA' or 'California'

Latitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees latitude of the centroid of the state, null otherwise

Longitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees longitude of the centroid of the state, null otherwise

ValidateStateRequest.description: Request to Validate a State or Province in a country

StateOrProvince.description: Required: State or province of the address to validate, such as 'California' or 'CA'

CountryFullName.description: Optional (recommended); Name of the country, such as 'United States'.  If left blank, and CountryCode is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

CountryCode.description: Optional; two-letter country code (Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code) of the country.  If left blank, and CountryFullName is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

ValidState.description: True if the address is valid, false otherwise

StateOrProvince.description: If valid; State or province corresponding to the input state name, such as 'CA' or 'California'

Latitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees latitude of the centroid of the state, null otherwise

Longitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees longitude of the centroid of the state, null otherwise

ValidatePostalCodeRequest.description: Request to Validate a Postal Code

PostalCode.description: Required: Zip code or postal code of the address to validate, such as '94597'

CountryFullName.description: Optional (recommended); Name of the country, such as 'United States'.  If left blank, and CountryCode is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

CountryCode.description: Optional; two-letter country code (Two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code) of the country.  If left blank, and CountryFullName is also left blank, will default to United States.  Global countries are supported.

ValidatePostalCodeResponse.description: Result of validating a postal code

ValidPostalCode.description: True if the Postal Code is valid, false otherwise

City.description: If valid, City corresponding to the input postal code, such as 'Walnut Creek'

StateOrProvince.description: If valid; State or province corresponding to the input postal code, such as 'CA' or 'California'

Latitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees latitude of the centroid of the postal code, null otherwise

Longitude.description: If the postal code is valid, the degrees longitude of the centroid of the postal code, null otherwise

ValidateCountryRequest.description: Input parameter to a country validation request

RawCountryInput.description: Raw country input - can be a two-letter code (FIPS 10-4 or ISO 3166-1), three-letter code (ISO 3166-1) or country name

ValidateCountryResponse.description: Result of performing a country validation operation

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

IsEuropeanUnionMember.description: True if this country is currently a member of the European Union (EU), false otherwise

ISOCurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency three-letter code associated with the country

Region.description: Region (continent) in which the country is located; possible values are None, Europe, Americas, Asia, Africa, Oceania

Subregion.description: Subregion in which the country is located; possible values are None, NorthernEurope, WesternEurope, SouthernEurope, EasternEurope, CentralAmerica, NorthernAmerica, SouthAmerica, EasternAfrica, MiddleAfrica, NorthernAfrica , SouthernAfrica , WesternAfrica , CentralAsia , EasternAsia , SouthernAsia , SouthEasternAsia , WesternAsia , Southern , Middle , AustraliaandNewZealand , Melanesia , Polynesia , Micronesia , Caribbean,

BaseUTCOffset.description: UTC offset for this time zone

Now.description: The current time (Now) in this time zone

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

Countries.description: List of current ISO 3166-1 countries in the world

IsEuropeanUnionMember.description: True if this country is currently a member of the European Union (EU), false otherwise

ISOCurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency three-letter code associated with the country

Region.description: Region (continent) in which the country is located; possible values are None, Europe, Americas, Asia, Africa, Oceania

Subregion.description: Subregion in which the country is located; possible values are None, NorthernEurope, WesternEurope, SouthernEurope, EasternEurope, CentralAmerica, NorthernAmerica, SouthAmerica, EasternAfrica, MiddleAfrica, NorthernAfrica , SouthernAfrica , WesternAfrica , CentralAsia , EasternAsia , SouthernAsia , SouthEasternAsia , WesternAsia , Southern , Middle , AustraliaandNewZealand , Melanesia , Polynesia , Micronesia , Caribbean,

GetTimezonesRequest.description: Request to get time zones for a country

CountryCodeOrName.description: Can be the two-letter, three-letter country codes or country name

GetTimezonesResponse.description: Result of performing a get time zones operation

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

ReverseGeocodeAddressRequest.description: Request to reverse geocode a Street Address

ReverseGeocodeAddressResponse.description: Result of reverse geocoding a street address

Successful.description: True if the address operation was successful, false otherwise

StreetAddress.description: Street address to validate, such as '2950 Buskirk Ave.'

City.description: City part of the addrerss to validate, such as 'Walnut Creek'

StateOrProvince.description: State or province of the address to validate, such as 'CA' or 'California'

PostalCode.description: Zip code or postal code of the address to validate, such as '94597'

CountryFullName.description: Name of the country, such as 'United States'.  Global countries are supported.

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

Now.description: Current date, time, and time zone in standard JSON date format

NowGmt.description: Current GMT-time-zone date, time, and time zone in standard JSON date format

GetPublicHolidaysRequest.description: Input parameter to a country validation request

RawCountryInput.description: Two-letter code (FIPS 10-4 or ISO 3166-1) of the country; if not specified, defaults to United States

Year.description: Optional - the year in which to retrieve the holidays; if left blank (0) it will default to the current year

PublicHolidaysResponse.description: Result of performing a get public holidays request operation

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

PublicHolidays.description: Public holidays in the requested country and year

EnglishName.description: Name of the holiday in English

HolidayType.description: Type of the holiday; possible values are: Public, Bank, School, Authorities, Optional, Observance

Nationwaide.description: True if the holiday is celebrated in all locales in the country, false otherwise

DateTimeStandardizedParseRequest.description: Input parameter to a date time parsing request

RawDateTimeInput.description: Raw string input of a standard-formatted date and time for parsing

CountryCode.description: Optional: specify the two-letter country code to optimzie date formatting; default is US

DateTimeStandardizedParseResponse.description: Result of performing a date time parsing

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

ParsedDateResult.description: Result of performing a date time parsing

Year.description: Year of the parsed date time result

Month.description: Month of the parsed date time result

Day.description: Day of the parsed date time result

Hour.description: Hour of the parsed date time result (24-hour)

Minute.description: Minute of the parsed date time result

Second.description: Second of the parsed date time result

DateTimeNaturalLanguageParseRequest.description: Input parameter to a date time parsing request

RawDateTimeInput.description: Raw string input of a natural language-formatted date and time for parsing

ValidDomain.description: True if the domain name was valid, false if it is not

DomainQualityResponse.description: Result of performing a domain quality score operation

DomainQualityScore.description: The quality score of the domain name; possible values are 0.0 to 10.0 with 10.0 being the highest and 0.0 being the lowest quality.

ValidDomain.description: True if the domain is valid, false if it is not

RegistrantOrganization.description: Organization name of the domain registrant

RegistrantEmail.description: Email address of the domain registrant

RegistrantStreetNumber.description: Street number of the address of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantStreet.description: Street name of the address of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantCity.description: City of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantStateOrProvince.description: State or Province of the address of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantPostalCode.description: Postal code of the address of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantCountry.description: Country of the address of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantRawAddress.description: Raw address string of the domain registrant, if available

RegistrantTelephone.description: Telephone number of the address of the domain registrant

WhoisServer.description: Server used to lookup WHOIS information (may change based on lookup).

ValidateUrlRequestSyntaxOnly.description: Request to determine if a URL is valid

ValidateUrlResponseSyntaxOnly.description: Result of validating a URL with syntax only

ValidURL.description: True if the URL is valid, false otherwise

TopLevelDomainName.description: The top-level domain name of the URL, e.g. mydomain.com

ValidateUrlRequestFull.description: Request to determine if a URL is valid

ValidateUrlResponseFull.description: Result of validating a URL with full validation

ValidURL.description: True if the URL has valid syntax, a valid domain, a valid endpoint, and passes virus scan checks; false otherwise

Valid_Syntax.description: True if the URL has valid syntax, false otherwise

Valid_Domain.description: True if the domain name is valid and exists, false otherwise

Valid_Endpoint.description: True if the endpoint is up and responsive and passes a virus scan check, false otherwise

PhishingCheckRequest.description: Request to determine if a URL is a Phishing threat

PhishingCheckResponse.description: Result of checking a URL for Phishing threats

CleanURL.description: True if the URL is clean, false if it is at risk of containing a Phishing threat or attack

ThreatType.description: Threat type of the Phishing threat; possible values are VerifiedPhishingURL, UnverifiedPhishingURL, or VerifiedPhishingDomain

IsAdminPathResponse.description: Result of performing an Admin Path operation

IsAdminPathNode.description: True if the input IP address is an Admin Path, and false otherwise

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

UrlSafetyCheckRequestFull.description: Request to determine if a URL is a safety threat check

UrlSafetyCheckResponseFull.description: Result of checking a URL for safety threats

CleanURL.description: True if the URL is clean, false if it is at risk of containing a safety threat or attack

ThreatType.description: Threat type identified, if any; possible values are "ForcedDownload", "VirusesAndMalware", "Phishing"

UrlSsrfRequestFull.description: Request to determine if a URL is an SSRF threat check

BlockedDomains.description: Top level domains that you do not want to allow access to, e.g. mydomain.com - will block all subdomains as well

UrlSsrfResponseFull.description: Result of checking a URL for SSRF threats

CleanURL.description: True if the URL is clean, false if it is at risk of containing an SSRF threat or attack

ThreatLevel.description: Threat level of the URL; possible values are High, Medium, Low and None

UrlSsrfRequestBatch.description: Batch operation to perform SSRF threat checks on multiple URLs

InputItems.description: Input URLs to check for SSRF threats

UrlSsrfResponseBatch.description: Result of performing SSRF threat checks on multiple URLs

OutputItems.description: Results of the operation, with indexes matched to input values

UrlHtmlSsrfRequestFull.description: Request to determine if a URL contains HTML-embedded SSRF threats

UrlHtmlSsrfResponseFull.description: Result of checking a URL for HTML-embedded SSRF threats

CleanURL.description: True if the URL is clean, false if it is at risk of containing an SSRF threat or attack

HttpResponseCode.description: HTTP response code from the URL

ValidAddress.description: True if the email address is syntactically valid, false if it is not

Domain.description: Domain name of the email address

IsFreeEmailProvider.description: True if the email domain name is a free provider (typically a free to sign up web email provider for consumers / personal use), false otherwise.

IsDisposable.description: True if the email address is a disposable email address, false otherwise; these disposable providers are not typically used to receive email and so will have a low likelihood of opening mail sent there.

AddressGetServersResponse.description: Result of a partial email address validation

Success.description: True if partial address validation was successufl, false otherwise

Servers.description: Email servers for this email address

ValidAddress.description: True if the email address is valid overall, false otherwise

MailServerUsedForValidation.description: Email server connected to for verification

Valid_Syntax.description: True if the syntax of the email address is valid, false otherwise.  This is one component of ValidAddress, but not the only one.

Valid_Domain.description: True if the domain name of the email address is valid, false otherwise.  This is one component of ValidAddress, but not the only one.

Valid_SMTP.description: True if the email address was verified by the remote server, false otherwise.  This is one component of ValidAddress, but not the only one.

IsCatchallDomain.description: True if the domain is a catch-all domain name, false otherwise.  Catch-all domain names, while rare, always accept inbound email to ensure they do not lose any potentially useful emails.  Catch-all domain names can occassionally be configured to first accept and store all inbound email, but then later send a bounce email back to the sender after a delayed period of time.

Domain.description: Domain name of the email address

IsFreeEmailProvider.description: True if the email domain name is a free provider (typically a free to sign up web email provider for consumers / personal use), false otherwise.

IsDisposable.description: True if the email address is a disposable email address, false otherwise; these disposable providers are not typically used to receive email and so will have a low likelihood of opening mail sent there.

IsBot.description: True if the IP address is a known bot, otherwise false

IsTorNode.description: True if the IP address is a known Tor exit node, otherwise false

IsThreat.description: True if the IP address is a known threat IP, otherwise false

IsEU.description: True if the IP address is in the European Union, otherwise false

Location.description: Returns the location of the IP address

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the IP address location

CurrencyName.description: Name of the currency in English

RegionArea.description: Region (continent) in which the country is located; possible values are None, Europe, Americas, Asia, Africa, Oceania

SubregionArea.description: Subregion in which the country is located; possible values are None, NorthernEurope, WesternEurope, SouthernEurope, EasternEurope, CentralAmerica, NorthernAmerica, SouthAmerica, EasternAfrica, MiddleAfrica, NorthernAfrica , SouthernAfrica , WesternAfrica , CentralAsia , EasternAsia , SouthernAsia , SouthEasternAsia , WesternAsia , Southern , Middle , AustraliaandNewZealand , Melanesia , Polynesia , Micronesia , Caribbean,

GeolocateResponse.description: Geolocation result of performing an IP address geolocation operation.  This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from www.maxmind.com.

CountryCode.description: Two-letter country code of IP address

ZipCode.description: Zip or postal code of IP address

CountryCode.description: Two-letter country code of IP address

ZipCode.description: Zip or postal code of IP address

IPThreatResponse.description: Result of performing a IP threat check on an IP address

IsThreat.description: True if the input IP address is a threat, false otherwise

ThreatType.description: Specifies the type of IP threat; possible values include Blocklist, Botnet, WebBot

TorNodeResponse.description: Result of performing a Tor node check on an IP address

IsTorNode.description: True if the input IP address is a Tor exit node, false otherwise

BotCheckResponse.description: Result of performing a Bot check on an IP address

IsBot.description: True if the input IP address is a Bot or Robot, false otherwise

IPReverseDNSLookupResponse.description: Result of performing a Reverse Domain (DNS) lookup on an IP address

Successful.description: True if a domain was found, false otherwise

HostName.description: Host name (fully-qualified) associated with the IP address, if any

LeadEnrichmentRequest.description: Input lead contact; fill in known fields to extend them with matched field values

ContactBusinessEmail.description: The person's business email address for the lead

ContactFirstName.description: The person's first name for the lead

ContactLastName.description: The person's last name for the lead

CompanyName.description: Name of the company for the lead

CompanyDomainName.description: Domain name / website for the lead

CompanyHouseNumber.description: House number of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyStreet.description: Street name of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCity.description: City of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyStateOrProvince.description: State or Province of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyPostalCode.description: Postal Code of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCountry.description: Country of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCountryCode.description: Country Code (2-letter ISO 3166-1) of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyTelephone.description: Telephone of the company office for the lead

CompanyVATNumber.description: VAT number of the company for the lead

LeadEnrichmentResponse.description: Result of the lead enrichment process

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

LeadType.description: The type of the lead; possible types are Junk (a single individual using a disposable/throwaway email address); Individual (a single individual, typically a consumer, not purchasing on behalf of a business); SmallBusiness (a small business, typically with fewer than 100 employees); MediumBusiness (a medium business, larger than 100 employees but fewer than 1000 employees); Enterprise (a large business with greater than 1000 employees); Business (a business customer of unknown size)

ContactBusinessEmail.description: The person's business email address for the lead

ContactFirstName.description: The person's first name for the lead

ContactLastName.description: The person's last name for the lead

ContactGender.description: Gender for contact name; possible values are Male, Female, and Neutral (can be applied to Male or Female).  Requires ContactFirstName.

CompanyName.description: Name of the company for the lead

CompanyDomainName.description: Domain name / website for the lead

CompanyHouseNumber.description: House number of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyStreet.description: Street name of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCity.description: City of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyStateOrProvince.description: State or Province of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyPostalCode.description: Postal Code of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCountry.description: Country Name of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyCountryCode.description: Country Code (2-letter ISO 3166-1) of the address of the company for the lead

CompanyTelephone.description: Telephone of the company office for the lead

CompanyVATNumber.description: VAT number of the company for the lead

EmployeeCount.description: Count of employees at the company (estimated), if available

FullNameValidationRequest.description: Request to validate a full name string

FullNameString.description: Full name to process as a free-form string; supports many components such as First Name, Middle Name, Last Name, Title, Nickname, Suffix, and Display Name

FullNameValidationResponse.description: Result of a full name validation operation

Successful.description: True if the validation operation was successful, false otherwise

ValidationResult_FirstName.description: Possible values are: ValidFirstName, ValidUnknownFirstName, InvalidSpamInput, InvalidCharacters, InvalidEmpty

ValidationResult_LastName.description: Possible values are: ValidLastName, ValidUnknownLastName, InvalidSpamInput, InvalidCharacters, InvalidEmpty

Title.description: The person's title (if supplied), e.g. "Mr." or "Ms."

MiddleName.description: The middle name(s); if there are multiple names they will be separated by spaces

Suffix.description: Suffix to the name, e.g. "Jr." or "Sr."

DisplayName.description: The full display name of the name

FirstNameValidationRequest.description: Request to validate a first name

FirstNameValidationResponse.description: Result of a first name validation operation

Successful.description: True if the validation operation was successful, false otherwise

ValidationResult.description: Possible values are: ValidFirstName, ValidUnknownFirstName, InvalidSpamInput, InvalidCharacters, InvalidEmpty

LastNameValidationRequest.description: Request to validate a last name

LastNameValidationResponse.description: Result of a last name validation operation

Successful.description: True if the validation operation was successful, false otherwise

ValidationResult.description: Possible values are: ValidLastName, ValidUnknownLastName, InvalidSpamInput, InvalidCharacters, InvalidEmpty

GetGenderRequest.description: Request to get the gender from a first name

FirstName.description: Input first name (given name) to get the gender of

CountryCode.description: Optional; the country for this name, possible values are "US", "LY", "NI", "TT", "MK", "KZ", "BO", "UG", "TZ", "CL", "SI", "MA", "RW", "VN", "AW", "CY", "BH", "SG", "ZA", "MU", "BR", "TN", "KH", "US", "TH", "TW", "UY", "DO", "CO", "UA", "QA", "BY", "SN", "SD", "FJ", "LB", "BE", "ML", "LV", "FR", "TM", "NG", "EC", "NO", "SL", "CR", "PA", "GE", "CH", "KR", "RS", "ZM", "FI", "BF", "MC", "AU", "GA", "LS", "RU", "IN", "SE", "LK", "BZ", "MX", "GH", "AF", "TJ", "BN", "DZ", "CM", "GR", "MD", "HN", "AT", "NZ", "SV", "GW", "NA", "AR", "MZ", "PK", "MN", "IQ", "BW", "VE", "PT", "BS", "AL", "TG", "ID", "ET", "CF", "JP", "BB", "PH", "CU", "BD", "AO", "SM", "LC", "ME", "RO",  DANIL"O"", "ES", "EE", "IL", "ZW", "SY", "MW", "LU", "IR", "SC", "NL", "JO", "AM", "DE", "GL", "OM", "DK", "HR", "LI", "TD", "KM", "BA", "GM", "GD", "CA", "CZ", "MR", "ST", "IS", "LR", "IE", "VC", "AE", "KG", "DJ", "TR", "KE", "NE", "UZ", "CN", "GQ", "SK", "BJ", "MG", "BT", "EG", "PL", "IT", "SA", "MY", "CI", "AG", "AD", "KS", "HU", "CG", "KP", "DM", "GN", "GT", "NP", "JM", "LA", "GB", "BG", "HT", "PE", "AZ", "LT", "SZ", "PY", "MT", "VA"

Successful.description: True if successful, false otherwise

Gender.description: Gender for this name; possible values are Male, Female, and Neutral (can be applied to Male or Female)

ValidateIdentifierRequest.description: Identifier validation request, including the input identifier as well as various identifier rules

AllowWhitespace.description: True if whitespace is allowed in the identifier, false otherwise

AllowHyphens.description: True if hyphens are allowd in the identifier, false otherwise

AllowUnderscore.description: True if underscores are allowed in the identifier, false otherwise

AllowNumbers.description: True if numbers are allowed in the identifier, false otherwise

AllowPeriods.description: True if periods are allowed in the identifier, false otherwise

MaxLength.description: Optional; maximum length, if any, of the identifier

MinLength.description: Optional; minimum length, if any, of the identifier

ValidateIdentifierResponse.description: Result of performing an identifier validation operation

ValidIdentifier.description: True if the input identifier is valid, false otherwise

Error.description: Resulting error from the identifier validation; possible errors are: "InputIsEmpty", "ContainsWhitespace", "ContainsNumbers", "ContainsHyphen", "ContainsUnderscore", "ContainsPeriod", "TooShort", "TooLong", "ContainsSpecialCharacters"

PhoneNumberValidateRequest.description: Request to validate a phone number

PhoneNumber.description: Raw phone number string to parse as input for validation

DefaultCountryCode.description: Optional, default country code.  If left blank, will default to "US".

PhoneNumberValidationResponse.description: Result from validating a phone number

IsValid.description: True if the phone number is valid, false otherwise

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false if there was an error during validation.  See IsValid for validation result.

PhoneNumberType.description:
Type of phone number; possible values are: FixedLine, Mobile, FixedLineOrMobile, TollFree, PremiumRate, 
SharedCost, Voip, PersonalNumber, Pager, Uan, Voicemail, Unknown

E164Format.description: E.164 format of the phone number

InternationalFormat.description: Internaltional format of the phone number

NationalFormat.description: National format of the phone number

CountryCode.description: Two digit country code of the phone number

CountryName.description: User-friendly long name of the country for the phone number

SqlInjectionDetectionResult.description: Result of performing an SQL Injection protection operation

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

ContainedSqlInjectionAttack.description: True if the input contained SQL Injection attacks, false otherwise

SqlInjectionCheckBatchRequest.description: Input to a batch SQL Injection detection operation

RequestItems.description: Multiple items to detect for SQL Injection

DetectionLevel.description: Set to Normal to target a high-security SQL Injection detection level with a very low false positive rate; select High to target a very-high security SQL Injection detection level with higher false positives.  Default is Normal (recommended).

SqlInjectionCheckRequestItem.description: Individual item to protect for SQL Injection

InputText.description: Individual input text item to check for SQL Injection

SqlInjectionCheckBatchResponse.description: Result of performing a batch XSS protection operation

ResultItems.description: Results from performing a batch SQL Injection detection operation; order is preserved from input data

XssProtectionResult.description: Result of performing an XSS protection operation

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

ContainedXss.description: True if the input contained XSS scripting, false otherwise

NormalizedResult.description: Normalized string result, with XSS removed

XssProtectionBatchRequest.description: Input to a batch XSS protection operation

RequestItems.description: Multiple items to protect for XSS

XssProtectionRequestItem.description: Individual item to protect for XSS

InputText.description: Individual input text item to protect from XSS

XssProtectionBatchResponse.description: Result of performing a batch XSS protection operation

ResultItems.description: Results from performing a batch XSS protection operation

HtmlSsrfDetectionResult.description: Result of performing an XXE threat detection operation

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

ContainedThreats.description: True if the input contained SSRF threats, false otherwise

XxeDetectionResult.description: Result of performing an XXE threat detection operation

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

ContainedXxe.description: True if the input contained XXE threats, false otherwise

XxeDetectionBatchRequest.description: Input to a batch XXE detection operation

RequestItems.description: Multiple items to protect for XXE

XxeDetectionRequestItem.description: Individual item to detect for XXE

InputText.description: Individual input text item to protect from XXE

AllowInternetUrls.description: Optional: Set to true to allow Internet-based dependency URLs for DTDs and other XML External Entitites, set to false to block.  Default is false.

KnownSafeUrls.description: Optional: Comma separated list of fully-qualified URLs that will automatically be considered safe.

KnownUnsafeUrls.description: Optional: Comma separated list of fully-qualified URLs that will automatically be considered unsafe.

XxeDetectionBatchResponse.description: Result of performing a batch XXE detection operation

ResultItems.description: Results from performing a batch XSS protection operation

UserAgentString.description: The user agent string you wish to parse and validate

UserAgentValidateResponse.description: The result of a User-Agent validation request

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

IsBot.description: True if the request is a known robot, false otherwise

BotName.description: Optional; name of the robot if the request was from a known robot, otherwise null

BotURL.description: Optional; if available, the URL to the robot

OperatingSystem.description: Operating System of the User-Agent (e.g. Windows)

OperatingSystemCPUPlatform.description: The CPU platform of the User-Agent (e.g. x64)

OperatingSystemVersion.description: The version of the operating system of the User-Agent (e.g. "10" for Windows 10)

DeviceType.description: Device type of the User-Agent; possible values are "DESKTOP", "SMARTPHONE", "TABLET"

DeviceModel.description: Model name or number of the User-Agent

VatLookupRequest.description: Input to a VAT lookup request

IsValid.description: True if the VAT code is valid, false otherwise

BusinessAddress.description: Business address as a single string

BusinessBuilding.description: For the business address, the name of the building, house or structure if applicable, such as "Cloudmersive Building 2".  This will often by null.

BusinessStreetNumber.description: For the business address, the street number or house number of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "1600".  This value will typically be populated for most addresses.

BusinessStreet.description: For the business address, the name of the street or road of the address.  For example, in the address "1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW" the street number would be "Pennsylvania Avenue NW".

BusinessCity.description: For the business address, the city of the address.

BusinessStateOrProvince.description: For the business address, the state or province of the address.

BusinessPostalCode.description: For the business address, the postal code or zip code of the address.

BusinessCountry.description: For the business address, country of the address, if present in the address.  If not included in the address it will be null.
